response.answer_text: As an immigrant of almost 25 years to Boston area from overseas I think we are a country. At least we are reminded of this constantly. Massachusetts is not America. :) Personally I think we are just better part of America. Loving it here. Architecture, saturation of educated people, professional opportunities.. ocean, river … mountains nearby. I’d say New England is a country.

While “The Hub” may be the entire universe to some of its denizens, it’s merely a city, not a country. (Don’t think it’s ever applied to the U.N. for membership!) And besides, to many of us on our side of the Charles, Boston is merely and overgrown suburb of Cambridge!
